DataElement.preferredName: Clinical Performed Observation Outcome Target Anatomic Site Laterality Code ISO21090.CD.v1.0
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A result of a clinical observation, i.e. from an examination, test or direct observation performed on the subject. EXAMPLE(S): The performed observation of "WBC count" would be associated to a clinical result called "WBC result" in which the results of the observation (13000 WBCs) would be stored. A coded value specifying the side of the body (or a paired organ) that is a target site for an observation result. EXAMPLE(S): bilateral, left, right.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Clinical Performed Observation Outcome Target Anatomic Site Laterality Code
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Relating to the examination and treatment of patients dependent on direct observation.  The term may also refer to the institution (clinic) providing this activity.:Executed and carried through to completion.:Watching something and taking note of what happens.:The result of an action._An object fixed as a goal or point of examination; something to point at; a destination.:Named locations of or within the body.:Dominant use or manifestations of one side of the body versus the other; referring to a side of the body or of a structure.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is given an arbitrary meaning within a systematized collection of concepts used for data representation.
